meanings.definition: To put into mechanical motion or action
meanings.sent1: She actuated the toy car by pressing the button.
meanings.sent2: The engineer actuated the robot to perform a task.
meanings.sent3: The remote control actuated the dancing robot, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: His words actuated a chain of events that led to significant changes in the company.
meanings.sent5: The wind actuated the windmill, making it spin gracefully.

meanings.definition: To incite or move to action
meanings.sent1: The motivational speaker actuated the audience to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent2: The inspiring story actuated her to volunteer at the shelter.
meanings.sent3: The promise of ice cream actuated the kids to finish their homework quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music actuated her to start her own band.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk actuated the team to give their best performance.

meanings.sent1: The urgent message actuated him to call for help immediately.
meanings.sent2: The emergency alarm actuated the evacuation procedure.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies actuated her to bake a batch herself.
meanings.sent4: The news of the upcoming test actuated the students to study diligently.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the finish line actuated the runners to sprint towards it.
